00043 Matrix MRO_Multiply::operator()(const MatrixAliasConstant& operand) const
00044 {
00045         Matrix result(getRows(), operand.getColumns());
00046         double thisElement;
00047         unsigned int i, j, k;
00048 
00049 
00050         if (operand.getRows() != getColumns()) {
00051                 error("MatrixAlias::operator* : Dimensions are not consistent\n");
00052                 return result; // Return empty matrix
00053         }
00054 
00055         for (i = 0; i < getRows(); i++) {
00056 
00057                 for (j = 0; j < operand.getColumns(); j++) {
00058 
00059                         thisElement = 0;
00060 
00061                         for (k = 0; k < getColumns(); k++) {
00062                                 thisElement += element(i, k) * operand.element(k, j);
00063                         }
00064 
00065                         result.element(i, j) = thisElement;
00066                 }
00067         }
00068 
00069         return result;
00070 }
00071 
00072 Matrix MRO_ElementMultiply::operator()(const MatrixAliasConstant& operand) const
00073 {
00074         Matrix result(getRows(), getColumns());
00075         unsigned int i, j;
00076 
00077         if (operand.getRows() != getRows() || operand.getColumns() != getColumns()) {
00078                 error("MatrixAlias::elementMultiply : Dimensions are not consistent\n");
00079                 return result; // Return empty matrix
00080         }
00081 
00082         for (i = 0; i < getRows(); i++) {
00083                 for (j = 0; j < getColumns(); j++) {
00084                         result.element(i, j) = operand.element(i,j) * element(i, j);
00085                 }
00086         }
00087 
00088         return result;
00089 }

00120 Matrix MRO_Add::operator()(const MatrixAliasConstant& operand) const
00121 {

00124 
00125         if (operand.getRows() != getRows() || operand.getColumns() != getColumns()) {
00126                 error("MRO_Add : Dimensions are not consistent\n");
00127                 return result; // Return empty matrix
00128         }
00129 
00130         for (i = 0; i < getRows()*getColumns(); i++) {
00131                 result.element(i) = element(i) + operand.element(i);

00210 {
00211         if(operand.getRows() == getRows() && operand.getColumns() == getColumns())
00212                 return 1; // Size is equal

00321 double MRO_Maximum::operator()() const {
00322 
00323         unsigned int i, j;
00324         double maxVal;
00325 
00326         maxVal = element(0);
00327 
00328         for (i = 0; i < getRows(); i++) {
00329                 for (j = 0; j < getColumns(); j++) {
00330                         maxVal = (element(i, j) > maxVal) ? element(i, j) : maxVal;
00331                 }
00332         }
00333 
00334         return maxVal;
00335 }

00361 double MRO_InfinityNorm::operator()() const {
00362 
00363         ColumnVector newVector(getRows());
00364         unsigned int i, j;
00365 
00366         for (i = 0; i < getRows(); i++) {
00367                 newVector.element(i) = 0;
00368                 for (j = 0; j < getColumns(); j++) {
00369                         newVector.element(i) += fabs(element(i, j));
00370                 }
00371         }
00372 
00373         return newVector.maximum();

00376 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00377 // Return the frobenius norm of this matrix
00378 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00379 
00380 double MRO_FrobeniusNorm::operator()() const {
00381 
00382         unsigned int i;
00383         double normSquared = 0;
00384 
00385         for (i = 0; i < (getRows() * getColumns()); i++) {
00386                 normSquared += element(i) * element(i);
00387         }
00388 
00389         return sqrt(normSquared);
00390 }

00400         unsigned int i, j;

00404                         newMatrix.element(i, j) *= element(i, j);

00419 void MWO_EqualsElementCopy::operator()(const MatrixAliasConstant& copy) const
00420 {
00421                 unsigned int i, j;
00422 
00423                 //printf("MWO_EqualsElementCopy called\n");
00424 
00425                 if(m_thisMatrix->sizeEqual(copy) == 0)
00426                 {
00427                         error("MWO_EqualsElementCopy : Dimensions are not consistent\n");
00428                         return;
00429                 }
00430 
00431                 /*if(copy.getRows() != getRows() || copy.getColumns() != getColumns()) {
00432                         error("MWO_EqualsElementCopy : Dimensions are not consistent\n");
00433                         return;
00434                 }*/
00435 
00436                 for (i = 0; i < getRows(); i++) {
00437                         for (j = 0; j < getColumns(); j++) {
00438 
00439                                 element(i, j) = copy.element(i, j);
00440                         }
00441                 }
00442 }

00444 void MWO_EqualsElementCopyResize::operator()(const MatrixAliasConstant& copy) const
00445 {
00446                 unsigned int i, j;
00447 
00448                 //printf("MWO_EqualsElementCopyResize called\n");
00449 
00450                 //printf("copy.getRows():%d\ngetRows():%d\ncopy.getColumns():%d\ncopy.getColumns():%d\n",copy.getRows(),getRows(),copy.getColumns(),copy.getColumns());
00451 
00452                 if(copy.getRows() != getRows() || copy.getColumns() != getColumns()) {
00453                         // Resize!!
00454 
00455                         // Change values
00456                         setRows(copy.getRows());
00457                         setColumns(copy.getColumns());
00458 
00459                         // Delete old memory
00460                         delete[] getDataPointer();
00461 
00462                         // Allocate new memory
00463                         setDataPointer(new double[getRows()*getColumns()]);
00464                 }
00465 
00466 
00467                 for (i = 0; i < getRows(); i++) {
00468                         for (j = 0; j < getColumns(); j++) {
00469                                 element(i, j) = copy.element(i, j);
00470                         }
00471                 }
00472 
00473 }

00475 void MWO_EqualsMemCopy::operator()(const MatrixAliasConstant& copy) const
00476 {
00477                 if(copy.getRows() != getRows() || copy.getColumns() != getColumns()) {
00478                         error("MWO_EqualsMemCopy : Dimensions are not consistent\n");
00479                         return;
00480                 }
00481 
00482                 // Perform a direct memory copy
00483                 memcpy(getDataPointer(), copy.getDataPointer(), sizeof(double)*getRows()*getColumns());
00484 
00485 }

00508 void MWO_Reshape::operator()(const unsigned int rows, const unsigned int columns) const
00509 {
00510         if((rows * columns) != (getRows() * getColumns())) {
00511                 error("MWO_Reshape : Dimensions are not consistent\n");
00512                 return;
00513         }
00514 
00515         // Change values
00516         setRows(rows);
00517         setColumns(columns);

00560 void MWO_Normalise::operator()() const
00561 {
00562         unsigned int i;
00563         double norm = m_thisMatrix->frobeniusNorm();
00564 
00565         for (i = 0; i < getRows()*getColumns(); i++) {
00566                 element(i) = element(i) / norm;
00567         }
00568 }

00576 }

00620 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00621 // Determinant
00622 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00623 
00624 double SqMRO_DeterminantBasic::operator()() const {
00625 
00626         unsigned int i;
00627         double det;
00628 
00629         if (getRows() == 1) {
00630 
00631                 det = element(0);
00632 
00633         } else if (getRows() == 2) {
00634 
00635                 det = element(0,0)*element(1,1) - element(0,1)*element(1,0);
00636 
00637         } else {
00638 
00639                 det = 0;
00640 
00641                 for (i = 0; i < getColumns(); i++) {
00642                         det     += element(i) * m_thisMatrix->cofactor(0, i);
00643                 }
00644         }
00645 
00646         return det;
00647 }
00648 
00649 
00650 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00651 // Determinant
00652 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00653 
00654 double SqMRO_DeterminantLUDecomp::operator()() const {
00655 
00656         double det;
00657 
00658         if (getRows() == 1) {
00659 
00660                 det = element(0);
00661 
00662         } else if (getRows() == 2) {
00663 
00664                 det = element(0,0)*element(1,1) - element(0,1)*element(1,0);
00665 
00666         } else {
00667 
00668                 SquareMatrix temp(*m_thisMatrix);
00669                 RowVector indices(getRows());
00670                 unsigned int j;
00671 
00672                 temp.luDecomposition(indices, &det);
00673                 for (j = 0; j < getRows(); j++) {
00674                         det *= temp(j, j);
00675                 }
00676         }
00677 
00678         return det;
00679 }
00680 
00681 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00682 // Cofactor
00683 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00684 
00685 double SqMRO_Cofactor::operator()(const unsigned int row, const unsigned int column) const {
00686 
00687         SquareMatrix newSquareMatrix(getRows() - 1);
00688         double sign;
00689 
00690         if (row >= getRows() || column >= getColumns()) {
00691                 error("SquareMatrixAlias::cofactor : Subscript out of range\n");
00692                 return 0;
00693         }
00694 
00695         sign = (row + column) % 2 ? -1 : 1;
00696 
00697         // Top left quadrant
00698         if (row > 0 && column > 0) {
00699                 newSquareMatrix.subMatrix(0, row-1, 0, column-1) = m_thisMatrix->subMatrix(0, row-1, 0, column-1);
00700         }
00701         // Top right quadrant
00702         if (row > 0 && column < (getColumns() - 1)) {
00703                 newSquareMatrix.subMatrix(0, row-1, column, getColumns()-2) = m_thisMatrix->subMatrix(0, row-1, column+1, getColumns()-1);
00704         }
00705         // Bottom left quadrant
00706         if (row < (getRows() - 1) && column > 0) {
00707                 newSquareMatrix.subMatrix(row, getRows()-2, 0, column-1) = m_thisMatrix->subMatrix(row+1, getRows()-1, 0, column-1);
00708         }
00709         // Bottom right quadrant
00710         if (row < (getRows() - 1) && column < (getColumns() - 1)) {
00711                 newSquareMatrix.subMatrix(row, getRows()-2, column, getColumns()-2) = m_thisMatrix->subMatrix(row+1, getRows()-1, column+1, getColumns()-1);
00712         }
00713 
00714         return sign * newSquareMatrix.determinant();
00715 }
00716 
00717 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00718 // Inverse
00719 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00720 
00721 SquareMatrix SqMRO_InverseBasic::operator()() const {
00722 
00723         SquareMatrix inv(getRows());
00724         unsigned int i, j;
00725         double det;
00726 
00727         det = m_thisMatrix->determinant();
00728 
00729         if (det == 0) {
00730                 error("SquareMatrixAlias::inverse : MatrixAlias is rank defficient\n");
00731                 return inv; // return blank matrix
00732         }
00733 
00734         for (i = 0; i < getRows(); i++) {
00735                 for(j = 0; j < getColumns(); j++) {
00736                         inv.element(j, i) = m_thisMatrix->cofactor(i, j) / det;
00737                 }
00738         }
00739 
00740         return inv;
00741 }
00742 
00743 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00744 // Inverse
00745 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00746 
00747 SquareMatrix SqMRO_InverseLUDecomp::operator()() const {
00748 
00749         SquareMatrix inv(*m_thisMatrix);
00750         RowVector indices(getRows()), column(getRows());
00751         unsigned int i, j;
00752         double sign;
00753 
00754         inv.luDecomposition(indices, &sign);
00755 
00756         for (j = 0; j < getColumns(); j++) {
00757                 column.zero();
00758                 column(j) = 1;
00759                 inv.luBackSubstitution(indices, column);
00760                 for (i = 0; i < getRows(); i++) {
00761                         inv(i,j) = column(i);
00762                 }
00763         }
00764 
00765         return inv;
00766 }
00767 
00768 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00769 // Return the matrix exponential using irreducible Pade approximation
00770 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00771 
00772 SquareMatrix SqMRO_Exponential::operator()(double time) const {
00773 
00774         SquareMatrix localCopy(getRows()), squaredCopy(getRows());
00775         SquareMatrix I(getRows()), Q(getRows()), P(getRows()), result(getRows());
00776         unsigned int nCoefs = 6;
00777         RowVector padeCoef(nCoefs + 1);
00778         unsigned int i, odd;
00779         double k, scaleFactor;
00780 
00781         // Multiply intime factor
00782         //localCopy = (*this) * time;
00783         localCopy.multiply(time);
00784 
00785         // Setup Pade coefficients
00786         padeCoef.element(0) = 1;
00787         for (i = 1; i <= nCoefs; i++) {
00788                 k = i;
00789                 padeCoef.element(i) = padeCoef.element(i-1) * ((nCoefs+1-k)/(k*(2*nCoefs+1-k)));
00790         }
00791 
00792         // Scale the matrix if necessary
00793         scaleFactor = m_thisMatrix->infinityNorm();
00794         if (scaleFactor > 0.5) {
00795 
00796                 scaleFactor = log(scaleFactor)/log((double)2);
00797                 scaleFactor = (scaleFactor > 0) ? floor(scaleFactor) : ceil(scaleFactor);
00798                 scaleFactor += 2;
00799                 scaleFactor = (scaleFactor > 0) ? scaleFactor : 0;
00800 
00801                 localCopy = pow((double)2,-scaleFactor) * localCopy;
00802         }
00803 
00804         // Horner evaluation of the irreducible fraction
00805         I.identity();
00806         squaredCopy = localCopy * localCopy;
00807         Q = padeCoef.element(nCoefs) * I;
00808         P = padeCoef.element(nCoefs-1) * I;
00809         odd = 1;
00810 
00811         for (i = (nCoefs - 1); i > 0; i--) {
00812 
00813                 if (odd == 1) {
00814                         Q = Q*squaredCopy + padeCoef.element(i-1)*I;
00815                 } else {
00816                         P = P*squaredCopy + padeCoef.element(i-1)*I;
00817                 }
00818 
00819                 odd = 1 - odd;
00820         }
00821 
00822         if (odd == 1) {
00823                 Q = Q*localCopy;
00824                 Q = Q - P;
00825                 result = -1*(I + 2 * (Q.inverse() * P));
00826         } else {
00827                 P = P*localCopy;
00828                 Q = Q - P;
00829                 result = I + 2 * (Q.inverse() * P);
00830         }
00831 
00832         // Squaring
00833         for (i = 0; i < (unsigned int)scaleFactor; i++) {
00834 
00835                 result = result * result;
00836         }
00837 
00838         return result;
00839 }
00840 
00841 
00842 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00843 // LU decomposition
00844 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00845 
00846 SquareMatrix SqMRO_LUDecomposition::operator()(RowVector &indx, double *d) const {
00847 
00848         SquareMatrix a(*m_thisMatrix);
00849         int n, i, imax, j, k;
00850         double big, dum, sum, temp;
00851         RowVector vv(a.getRows());
00852 
00853         n = a.getRows();
00854 
00855         // No row interchanges yet
00856         *d = 1.0;
00857 
00858         // Loop over rows to get implicit scaling information
00859         for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
00860                 big = 0.0;
00861                 for (j = 0; j < n; j++) {
00862                         temp = fabs(a.element(i,j));
00863                         if (temp > big) {
00864                                 big = temp;
00865                         }
00866                 }
00867                 if (big == 0.0) {
00868                         error("SquareMatrixAlias::luDecomp : MatrixAlias is rank defficient\n\n");
00869                         return a;
00870                 }
00871                 vv(i) = 1 / big;
00872         }
00873 
00874         // Loop over columns (Crout's method)
00875         for (j = 0; j < n; j++) {
00876                 for (i = 0; i < j; i++) {
00877                         sum = a.element(i,j);
00878                         for (k = 0; k < i; k++) {
00879                                 sum -= a.element(i,k) * a.element(k,j);
00880                         }
00881                         a.element(i,j) = sum;
00882                 }
00883                 big = 0;
00884                 for (i = j; i < n; i++) {
00885                         sum = a.element(i,j);
00886                         for (k = 0; k < j; k++) {
00887                                 sum -= a.element(i,k) * a.element(k,j);
00888                         }
00889                         a.element(i,j) = sum;
00890 
00891                         dum = vv(i) * fabs(sum);
00892                         if (dum >= big) {
00893                                 big = dum;
00894                                 imax = i;
00895                         }
00896                 }
00897                 if (j != imax) {
00898                         for (k = 0; k < n; k++) {
00899                                 dum = a.element(imax,k);
00900                                 a.element(imax,k) = a.element(j,k);
00901                                 a.element(j,k) = dum;
00902                         }
00903                         *d = -(*d);
00904                         vv(imax) = vv(j);
00905                 }
00906                 indx.element(j) = imax;
00907                 // Singularity may arise as aresult of rounding errors
00908                 // Substitute in small values for zeros
00909                 if (a.element(j,j) == 0) {
00910                         error("SquareMatrixAlias::luDecomp : MatrixAlias is rank defficient\n\n");
00911                         a.element(j,j) = 1e-100;
00912                 }
00913                 if (j != n) {
00914                         dum = 1 / a.element(j,j);
00915                         for (i = j+1; i < n; i++) {
00916                                 a.element(i,j) *= dum;
00917                         }
00918                 }
00919         }
00920 
00921         return a;
00922 }
00923 
00924 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00925 // LU back substitution
00926 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00927 
00928 SquareMatrix SqMRO_LUBackSubstitution::operator()(RowVector &indx, RowVector &b) const {
00929 
00930         SquareMatrix a(*m_thisMatrix);
00931         int n, i, j, ip, ii = -1;
00932         double sum;
00933 
00934         n = a.getRows();
00935 
00936         for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
00937                 ip = (int)indx(i);
00938                 sum = b.element(ip);
00939                 b.element(ip) = b.element(i);
00940                 if (ii != -1) {
00941                         for (j = ii; j < i; j++) {
00942                                 sum -= a.element(i,j) * b.element(j);
00943                         }
00944                 } else if (sum) {
00945                         ii = i;
00946                 }
00947                 b.element(i) = sum;
00948         }
00949         for (i = (n - 1); i >= 0; i--) {
00950                 sum = b.element(i);
00951                 for (j = (i + 1); j < n; j++) {
00952                         sum -= a.element(i,j) * b.element(j);
00953                 }
00954                 b.element(i) = sum / a.element(i,i);
00955         }
00956 
00957         return a;
00958 }

00961 
00962 //--------------------------------------------------------------
00963 //                              SquareMatrix Write Operators
00964 //--------------------------------------------------------------
00965 
00966 void SqMWO_EqualsElementCopyResize::operator()(const MatrixAliasConstant& copy) const
00967 {
00968                 unsigned int i, j;
00969 
00970                 if(copy.isSquareMatrix() == 0)
00971                 {
00972                         error("SqMWO_EqualsElementCopyResize: Matrix to copy is not a square matrix\n");
00973                         return;
00974                 }
00975 
00976 
00977                 if(copy.getColumns() != getColumns()) {
00978                         // Resize!!
00979 
00980                         // Change values
00981                         setRows(copy.getRows());
00982                         setColumns(copy.getColumns());
00983 
00984                         // Delete old memory
00985                         delete[] getDataPointer();
00986 
00987                         // Allocate new memory
00988                         setDataPointer(new double[getRows()*getColumns()]);
00989                 }
00990 
00991 
00992                 for (i = 0; i < getRows(); i++) {
00993                         for (j = 0; j < getColumns(); j++) {
00994                                 element(i, j) = copy.element(i, j);
00995                         }
00996                 }
00997 }
00998 
00999 void SqMWO_Resize::operator()(const unsigned int size) const
01000 {
01001         // Change values
01002         setRows(size);
01003         setColumns(size);
01004 
01005         // Delete old memory
01006         delete[] getDataPointer();
01007 
01008         // Allocate new memory
01009         setDataPointer(new double[size*size]);
01010 }

01012 void SqMWO_Identity::operator()() const
01013 {
01014         unsigned int i;
01015 
01016         m_thisMatrix->zero();
01017 
01018         for (i = 0; i < getRows(); i++) {
01019                 element(i,i) = 1;
01020         }
01021 
01022 }

01025 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01026 // Make this a direction cosine matrix 1
01027 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01028 
01029 void SqMWO_DirectionCosine::operator()(ColumnVectorAlias attitude) {
01030         if (attitude.getRows() != 3) {
01031                 error("Cannot compute direction cosine matrix for an attitude vector without 3 rows\n");
01032                 m_thisMatrix->zero();
01033                 //return *this;
01034         }
01035         m_thisMatrix->directionCosine(attitude.element(0), attitude.element(1), attitude.element(2));
01036 }
01037 
01038 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01039 // Make this a direction cosine matrix 2
01040 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01041 
01042 void SqMWO_DirectionCosine::operator()(double phi, double theta, double psi) {
01043 
01044         double sx, sy, sz;
01045         double cx, cy, cz;
01046 
01047         // Check size of square matrix is valid
01048         if (getRows() != 3) {
01049                 error("Cannot compute direction cosine matrix for a matrix without 3 rows and columns\n");
01050                 m_thisMatrix->zero();
01051                 //return *this;
01052         }
01053 
01054         // Calculate sines and cosines
01055         sx = sin(phi);
01056         sy = sin(theta);
01057         sz = sin(psi);
01058         cx = cos(phi);
01059         cy = cos(theta);
01060         cz = cos(psi);
01061 
01062         // Set the elements of the matrix
01063         element(0,0) = cy*cz;
01064         element(0,1) = cy*sz;
01065         element(0,2) = -sy;
01066 
01067         element(1,0) = sx*sy*cz-cx*sz;
01068         element(1,1) = sx*sy*sz+cx*cz;
01069         element(1,2) = sx*cy;
01070 
01071         element(2,0) = cx*sy*cz+sx*sz;
01072         element(2,1) = cx*sy*sz-sx*cz;
01073         element(2,2) = cx*cy;
01074 
01075         // Return a reference to ourselves
01076         //return *this;
01077 }

01092 
01093 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01094 // Cross product
01095 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01096 
01097 RowVector RVRO_CrossProduct::operator()(const RowVectorAliasConstant &operand) const {
01098 
01099         RowVector result(getColumns());
01100 
01101         if (operand.getColumns() != getColumns()) {
01102 
01103                 error("RowVectorAlias::cross : Dimensions are not consistent\n");
01104 
01105         } else if (operand.getRows() != 3) {
01106 
01107                 error("RowVectorAlias::cross : Only vectors of length 3 are valid at this time\n");
01108 
01109         } else {
01110 
01111                 result(0) = element(1) * operand(2) - element(2) * operand(1);
01112                 result(1) = element(2) * operand(0) - element(0) * operand(2);
01113                 result(2) = element(0) * operand(1) - element(1) * operand(0);
01114         }
01115 
01116         return result;
01117 }
01118 
01119 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01120 // Dot product
01121 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01122 
01123 double RVRO_DotProduct::operator()(const RowVectorAliasConstant &operand) const {
01124 
01125         double result = 0;
01126         unsigned int i;
01127 
01128         if (operand.getColumns() != getColumns()) {
01129 
01130                 error("RowVectorAlias::dot : Dimensions are not consistent\n");
01131 
01132         } else {
01133 
01134                 for (i = 0; i < getColumns(); i++) {
01135                         result += element(i) * operand.element(i);
01136                 }
01137         }
01138 
01139         return result;
01140 }

01143 // Direction of this vector
01144 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01145 
01146 RowVector RVRO_Direction::operator()() const
01147 {
01148         RowVector result(m_thisMatrix);
01149 
01150         result.normalise();
01151         return result;
01152 }

01180                 }
01181 
01182 
01183                 for (i = 0; i < getColumns(); i++) {
01184                         element(0, i) = copy.element(0, i);
01185                 }
01186
